alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 04 at 3:34AM MST until March 04 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM MST ACROSS THE WEST CENTRAL HIGHLANDS, MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY, NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS, SANDIA/MANZANO AND GALLINAS MOUNTAINS, AND EASTERN PLAINS BELOW SIGNIFICANT SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY.. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FOR SATURDAY AFTERNOON FOR EASTERN PLAINS OF NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .An upper level disturbance will bring strong southwest winds aloft into New Mexico today. Through the afternoon, these strong winds will mix down to the surface with gusty conditions expected over much of southwestern, central, and eastern New Mexico. In addition, above average warmth will remain in place with dry conditions, low humidity, and an unstable atmosphere. This will lead to several hours of critical fire weather. Strong winds and low humidity are expected to redevelop and align over the eastern plains of New Mexico Saturday afternoon where critical fire weather conditions will one again threaten. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...West Central Highlands, Middle Rio Grande Valley, Northeast Highlands, Sandia/Manzano and Gallinas Mountains below significant snowpack from 11 AM today through 8 PM MST this evening. The most critical conditions will occur during mid to late afternoon when winds will be the strongest. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 35 mph with occasional gusts of 40 to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Dropping between 9 to 15 percent in the late afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning for today.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands
